title: MS AccessHour()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessHour()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the hour for a specified time:
SELECT 
  Hour(#14:48:23#);

Definition and Usage
The Hour() function returns the hour part of a time/datetime.
This function returns an integer between 0 and 23.
Syntax
Hour(
time
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
time
Required. A numeric or string expression that can represent a valid 
    time/datetime
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Return the hour for the current time:
SELECT 
  Hour(Now());

Example
Return the hour for a specified datetime:
SELECT Hour(#24/10/2016 11:18:34 PM#);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessHour()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessHour()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessHour()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
